review_title: The epidemy of a stereotypical "Corporate Office"
pros: -Pay. The only reason I stuck around
cons:
-The office environment was cold, unwelcoming, and depressing. I can honestly say this office job made me never want to work in an office again.  
-Office politics like you wouldn't believe.

pros: Global footprint with large market focus and diverse opportunities.
cons: Existing US employee population does not reflect US distribution:  lacking in Women & minority leaders.  Appear to be hiring externally to bring in leaders or expatriating French rather than developing US employees.

pros: Lots of opportunities to grow career. Industry leading knowledge. Industry leading research and development.
cons: Business processes are extremely inefficient and decisions of almost any size seem to take forever.  Long hours expected depending on department.

have chance to engage in many projects, developed skills covered a broad ranges of department

pros: Very relaxed work environment, where everyone is on the same team yet the disciple exists and the job still moves forward.

pros: fast paced, high potential for growth, dynamic and diverse

pros: Great co-workers. Good work/life balance.
cons: Salaries are subpar. Management bites off more than they can chew, and lower level employees pay the price.

pros: Great office environment - everyone was very friendly and helpful. There wasn't too much work so it could be a little slow, but that was the only issue I had while there.
cons: Again, it could get a little slow at times.

pros: Lots of opportunity for movement internally if you pay your dues in your first role; 9/80 schedule; recent move into a brand new corporate office building

pros: Great people and company to work with.  I've enjoyed my 30+ years.
cons: There has been a lot of job stress with the new company transitions over the last 6 months.

pros: Best avenue to develop your talents and skills. The leaders are helping you to grow in your career. Best place with worker relationship.
